newsitem.title: GREECE: EU INVESTMENT BANK LENDS GREECE $254MLN FOR GAS NETWORK - PLATT'S.
newsitem.headline: EU INVESTMENT BANK LENDS GREECE $254MLN FOR GAS NETWORK - PLATT'S.

text.p: The European Investment Bank, the lending arm of the European Union, signed a new 60.6 billion drachma ($254 million) loan agreement with the Public Gas Corporation of Greece, Platt's said.
The loan will help finance the construction and operation of a high pressure transmission and distribution system for natural gas in Greece, the EIB said.
Construction work on this project began in 1990 and it is expected to begin operation in 1999, the bank added.
